skill.name: pr-prepare
skill.description: Prepare pull request descriptions for template changes. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, pull request, ready for PR, draft PR, write PR
skill.summary: Prepare pull request descriptions for template changes. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, pull re...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution. Only contains workflow instructions and PR description templates.

content.value_statement: Creating quality pull request descriptions for template changes requires consistent structure and context gathering. This skill provides a standardized workflow with templates for generating comprehensive PR descriptions.
actual_capabilities: Gather git context with status, log, and diff commands
Analyze template change scope and breaking impacts
Generate structured PR descriptions using templates
Suggest PR titles following conventional commit format
limitations: Only activates for template-related PR workflows
Does not auto-execute git commands (user must run them)
Does not validate or test template generation

use_cases.title: Standardize PR Workflow
use_cases.description: Create consistent, comprehensive PR descriptions when updating cookiecutter templates.

use_cases.title: Document Template Changes
use_cases.description: Generate clear PR descriptions that explain scope and impact of template modifications.

use_cases.title: Track Template Updates
use_cases.description: Maintain documentation standards for template CI/CD and configuration changes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR Preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a pull request description for the current changes.

prompt_templates.title: Complete PR Package
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete PR description with title, summary, scope, impact, and testing notes.

prompt_templates.title: Template Change Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the current git changes and tell me what scope they cover.

prompt_templates.title: PR Title Suggestion
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a conventional commit format PR title for these changes.

output_examples.input: Prepare a pull request description for adding CodeRabbit integration
output: Suggested Title: feat(template): add CodeRabbit AI code review integration
Summary: Add CodeRabbit AI code reviews as optional feature for generated projects.
Impact: Projects can enable AI code reviews via include_coderabbit option
Testing: Template generates successfully with default and enabled options

best_practices: Test template generation before pushing PR changes
Use conventional commit scopes (template, hooks, docs, config, ci)
Clearly document any breaking changes for existing template users
anti_patterns: Skipping git context gathering and making assumptions
Omitting scope checklist or leaving items unchecked
Using vague titles without conventional commit format

faq.question: What triggers this skill?
faq.answer: Keywords like prepare PR, create PR, draft PR, write PR, or pull request description.

faq.question: Does it execute git commands?
faq.answer: No. It provides the commands to run and uses the results you provide.

faq.question: What templates does it use?
faq.answer: Standard PR templates with summary, changes, scope, impact, testing, and notes sections.

faq.question: Can I customize the output?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill generates a starting template you can edit before submitting.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. No data leaves your environment. Only local git commands are suggested.

faq.question: What scopes are supported?
faq.answer: template, hooks, config, docs, and ci scopes for conventional commit titles.
